Do you know why December 8th is a national holiday? Today we celebrate the day of the Immaculate Conception, invoking the life and virtue of the Virgin Mary, mother of Jesus.
A religious festival is held that celebrates a Catholic dogma defined as a universal festival in 1476 by Pope Sixtus IV. On March 25, 1646, King D. JoÃ£o IV organized a solemn ceremony, in Vila ViÃ§osa, to thank Our Lady for the Restoration of Portugal's Independence from Spain. He went to the church of Nossa Senhora da ConceiÃ§Ã£o, declaring her patron saint and queen of Portugal.
Since that day, no Portuguese king has worn a crown on his head, a privilege that would only be available to the Immaculate Conception.

title:
J.K. Rowling mudou-se para o Porto apÃ³s a morte da mÃ£e, Anne, em 1991, depois de ter visto no jornal The Guardian um anÃºncio de uma escola de lÃ­ngua portuguesa, que procurava uma professora de inglÃªs.
Consigo trouxe o manuscrito inacabado de Harry Potter esperando conseguir terminÃ¡-lo entre as aulas. Durante a temporada em que viveu no Porto, Joanne Rowling trabalhou no manuscrito de Harry Potter e a Pedra Filosofal.
Foi numa das mesas de mÃ¡rmore do mÃ­tico cafÃ© portuense MAJESTIC que a britÃ¢nica terminou o primeiro rascunho de Harry Potter e a Pedra Filosofal. Foi, aliÃ¡s, na Invicta que Rowling escreveu aquele que viria a ser o seu capÃ­tulo favorito do seu romance de estreia â€“ â€œO Espelho dos InvisÃ­veisâ€.
Hoje assinalam-se 26 anos do lanÃ§amento do primeiro livro.
...

JK Rowling moved to Porto after the death of her mother, Anne, in 1991, after seeing an ad in The Guardian newspaper for a Portuguese language school looking for an English teacher.

I brought the unfinished manuscript of Harry Potter with me, hoping to get it finished between classes. During the time she lived in Porto, Joanne Rowling worked on the manuscript of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone.

It was at one of the marble tables at the mythical Porto cafÃ© MAJESTIC that the British artist finished the first draft of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone. It was, in fact, at Invicta that Rowling wrote what would become her favorite chapter of her debut novel â€“ â€œThe Mirror of the Invisiblesâ€.

Today marks 26 years since the launch of the first book.

title:
Traveling as a learning experience â˜•ï¸

Today Iâ€™m sowing you the story I captured around @combi_coffee while in Portugal a few weeks ago.

Traveling is a learning experience when talking about photography.

With or without your camera your eyes experience wonder and awe ğŸ¥¹ youâ€™ll never be the same person

When you are traveling you anchor yourself in the present and create space to observe

In those moments you encounter stories with a fresh perspective and open eyes

Visiting Combi Coffee a capturing a few moments there without caring about the end result, just admiring the beauty around coffee cultureâ€¦

It made me feel in love with the place, the people and of course the coffee (one of my favorite by far)

Hope this inspire you to open your eyes and go outside to find the beauty around you, and of course to grab a cup of coffee â˜•ï¸

â€”â€”â€”
Gear
- Capture with Canon R5 - 100mm 2.8 - 28-70mm 2.0 by @canonespana @kinafoto
- Editing software: #LightroomMobile @lightroom
â€”â€”â€”

.

Viajar como experiencia de aprendizaje â˜•ï¸

Hoy les cuento la historia que capturÃ© en @combi_coffee mientras estuve en Portugal hace unas semanas.

Viajar es una experiencia de aprendizaje cuando se trata de fotografÃ­a.

Con o sin tu cÃ¡mara, tus ojos experimentan asombro y admiraciÃ³n ğŸ¥¹ nunca volverÃ¡s a ser la misma persona.

Cuando viajas, te anclas en el presente y creas espacio para observar.

En esos momentos te encuentras con historias con una perspectiva fresca y los ojos abiertos.

Visitar Combi Coffee y capturar algunos momentos allÃ­ sin importar el resultado final, solo admirando la belleza que rodea la cultura del cafÃ©â€¦

Me hizo enamorarme del lugar, la gente y, por supuesto, del cafÃ© (uno de mis favoritos por diferencia).

Espero que esto te inspire a abrir los ojos y salir a buscar la belleza que te rodea y, por supuesto, a tomar una taza de cafÃ© â˜•ï¸

title:
@combi_coffee is a specialty coffee roastery, located in Porto, Portugal. It all started in 2014 with an old Mercedes van that, for two years, brought specialty coffee to various stops, including festivals, markets and streets in and around Porto.

Since 2017 Combi has been a fixed-space coffee shop and also a factory where they roast green beans from different origins, both for consumption in house and for selling to their customers.

Always trying to improve themselves and their, coffee they roast, they are sourcing only great coffees for their customers. They are aiming to build relationships with the farmers and ensure they get paid a fair and high price for the coffee they produce.

This coffee shop is a strong candidate to be on the list THE WORLDâ€™S 100 BEST COFFEE SHOPS. â˜•ï¸ ğŸ¤

Stay tuned to our social networks to know the first list where you will find the best coffee shops from 100 to 1!!!ğŸ¥‡

title:
@combi_coffee is a specialty coffee roastery founded by brothers GonÃ§alo and Francisco Cardoso, located in Porto, Portugal. It all started with an old Mercedes van that, for two years, brought specialty coffee to various stops, including festivals, markets, and streets in Porto and its surroundings.

In 2017, they opened their first coffee shops, where they also roast their own green coffee from different origins, both for home consumption and for sale to their customers. Combiâ€™s goal is to build relationships with farmers and ensure they receive a fair and high price for the coffee they produce.

This coffee shop is a strong candidate to be on the list THE WORLDâ€™S 100 BEST COFFEE SHOPS. â˜•ï¸ ğŸ¤

Stay tuned to our social networks to know the first list where you will find the best coffee shops from 100 to 1!!!ğŸ¥‡

title:
did you know that coffee in itâ€™s origin is a fruit? a coffee cherry contains one to two beans that get extracted and prepared in the country of their origin. when the beans arrive to our roastery they are green. only by roasting they change in color from green to yellow, caramel to the brown beans that you can buy in our shop.
roasting brings out the flavours the beans have inside. we try to roast the beans to their personal perfect level so we and you can enjoy the most out of them!

What are the benefits of subscribing?
1. Be the first to try our coffees before theyâ€™re officially released.
2. Receive a curated bundle for the entire monthâ€”no need to choose!

What are the available options?
â€¢ Choose between a Filter or Espresso bundle.
â€¢ Pick either two 250g bags of different varieties or four 250g bags (two of each variety).
â€¢ Subscribe for 3, 6, or 12 monthsâ€”whatever suits you best.
â€¢ Select your ideal subscription plan on our website.

How does it work?
1. We roast the subscription coffee on the first Monday of each month.
2. Your coffee is shipped by the first Wednesday of the month.
3. To receive the subscription for the upcoming month, you need to sign up by the last Friday of the previous month.

Example:
â€¢ You subscribe to the 3-month plan on February 25th and make your first payment.
â€¢ On March 3rd (the first Monday of the month), we roast and pack your coffee.
â€¢ Your coffee is shipped between March 4th and 5th.
â€¢ The same process repeats in April and May.

If I subscribe on March 1st, will I still get Marchâ€™s coffee?
No. Our subscription coffees are roasted and shipped only once per month, in the first week. To receive Marchâ€™s coffee, you would need to have subscribed by the last Friday of February (Feb 28th in this case).
Since your subscription was placed after the cut-off, it will be scheduled for Aprilâ€™s batch. Your first coffee bundle will arrive in the first week of April.

The cupping method, which we use for coffee evaluation, along with a consistent tasting routine, helps us assess the quality of our work, identify adjustments needed, and determine how to approach each coffee during roasting and brewing.

The main advantage of this method is its simplicity â€” itâ€™s independent of brewing skills and can be used anywhere in the world, allowing everyone from the farm to the roastery to taste the same coffee.

Have you ever tried this method, or would you like to learn more about it?

Located in the heart of the historic center of Cascais, our Cascais store is the only one among our units that serves brunch with a sea breeze.

A mix of aristocratic architecture and a more traditional fishing heritage, Cascais is an unmissable tourist destination. One hour from Lisbon, the village is known for its fine sandy beaches and blue waters.

In the summer of 2022, we opened our first Cascais unit at number 26B Avenida Valbom. Just a short walk from the train station and the beach, this unit stands out with its wide, shaded terrace â€“ a great spot to start the day with our Avo Toast and an espresso from our delicious Tero Farm.

Weâ€™d like to take this moment to send a big thank you to all the locals who have welcomed us with open arms from the start. Thank you for making our Cascais store a comfortable, friendly place where we always find familiar faces.

Last Call Subscription! ğŸ“©â˜•ï¸

December is almost over, and with all the festivities and celebrations, we donâ€™t want you to miss out on Januaryâ€™s subscription coffees.

To kick off 2025 in style, both the espresso and filter subscriptions will feature a microlot coffee â€“ a small, carefully selected batch with unique characteristics that highlight the farmerâ€™s skill and the specific growing conditions.

For Espresso: Natural, creamy, and fruity

Oromia Organic, Ethiopia: The natural processing of this organic coffee will bring a creamy and delicate espresso. Youâ€™ll notice strawberry and red fruit notes, which are typical of Ethiopian coffee.

Gisheke Microlot, Rwanda: This espresso microlot stands out for its fruity and funky flavor. A balanced, sweet, and full-bodied coffee, perfect for an espresso or a different milk-based drink.

For Filter: Washed and South American

Toliman, Guatemala: This washed coffee offers a clean and bright cup. With notes of nuts and a creamy texture, Toliman is the comfort food of coffees.

San Gabriel Microlot, Colombia: This filter microlot is a great example of a delicate coffee. With floral and vanilla notes and a light malic acidity typical of green apples, it makes an excellent V60.

Join our subscription by December 31st to receive these freshly roasted coffees on January 6th.

title:
We teamed up with one of our expert baristas to create a bulletproof espresso recipe for our Christmas Coffee Blend. Hereâ€™s the result:

1. Grind 18.8 g of the Christmas Coffee Blend. We used grind size number 2 on our @sageapplianceseu Smart Grinder Pro.
2. In 28 seconds, we pulled a 40 ml double espresso using our @lamarzocco Linea Mini.
3. Enjoy the delicious caramel and chocolate notes in your coffee or latte!

Use this recipe as a starting point and adapt it to the gear you have. Or visit our website to explore all our coffee gear options and level up your espresso and coffee rituals!

title:
EXCITING NEWS! âœ¨

We're on the lookout for a talented manager to lead our seven bustling cafes in Lisbon and Cascais. The position starts on May 2nd, 2023.

As the chosen candidate, you'll be responsible for managing our cafes' daily operations, and we're seeking someone with full availability as our shops are open every day. We're looking for someone with a strong commitment to this role, and we expect you to be a part of our team for at least two years, helping us to grow and thrive sustainably.

If you're interested in joining us, please send your application to jobs@fabricacoffeeroasters.com, including a motivational letter and CV. Applications in either English or Portuguese are accepted, and please make sure to mention "Area Manager" in the subject line.

We can't wait to hear from you! Don't forget to apply before April 7th, 2023!

This coffee is grown in the volcanic mountains of the northern province of Rwanda, where the plantâ€™s growing conditions are ideal thanks to the high altitudes, excellent soils, and favorable climate.

The Nova Coffee project is proudly run by Rwandan women and committed to female education, they hand select and process the coffee beans using the harvest method.

In the CafÃ© des Mamas, you can clearly taste Rwandan girl power. Grown with love by great farmers, enjoy it!

You can order to your door step and soon in our stores!

I should mention at this point that that toastie is the only lunch item she can eat from your entire menu. The only option she has due to her having an allergy not because shes making a choice to be vegan. Today after school I gave her a few options of places to eat as a treat. She chose Costa as she really wanted a vegan cheese an ham toastie. However, When we arrived we were told that the only vegan/allergen free option available to her had been removed from the menu for the festive period. Disappointed would be a massive understament. She was absolutely devasted and as her mum I felt gutted for her. Unlike most people who can eat a normal diet and have many options from your menu she didn't have another option so not only was she upset to find it wasn't available anymore she was upset because she was hungry and there was nothing for her to eat. Of all the things you could swap for the festive menu why remove the one vegan/ allergen option? There is a large portion of the population who suffer from allergies now and heavily rely on these options when eating out and large percentage of these are children. ['You may not have heard of Home Farm, but you have heard of Costa Coffee. Home Farm supplies Freshways, who provide milk to Costa Coffee, one of the nationâ€™s largest coffee shop chains.Viva! Campaigns uncovered rampant cruelty at Kentâ€™s Home Farm dairy and we enlisted your help to expose the abhorrent reality of dairy farming to the British public.

Viva! Campaigns investigated Home Farm in Kent after a tip-off. We were horrified by what we found there â€“ but what happens here happens on thousands of farms across the UK, every single day. We found cows that were emaciated, lame and struggling to walk, others manhandled, slapped and shoved, and yet more visibly injured or in shackles.

This is modern dairy farming! ['Heck yes â¤ï¸ğŸ™Œ', 'Omg can you pleeeeease make more vegan options ğŸ«¶ğŸ¤­ğŸ˜­ I CAN HELP YOU!!! (Heart if you agree!) â£ï¸', 'Hi Tim H, I had to write. Boo,,,, USA .", "I'm a proud American who loves Canada, hockey, and Tim's.â¤", 'Thank you for supporting Canadian Dairy Farmers ğŸ©µ', 'I am Brazilian and Tim Hortons had been with me on an unforgettable one-month journey through Calgary in 2005! I will never forget your hot coffees!', 'Buy second cup instead if you want to support ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦', 'ğŸ˜¢The Tim Hortons brand is American owned (A Burger King Co.) but a majority of the franchises in Canada are owned by Canadian families.ğŸ˜¢', 'I just spent half an hour researching this and it seems that for every $1 spent with you, more of it goes to the USA than Canada.

Yes, suppliers are local to Canada. Yes, Franchisees are Canadian. And yes you do pay Canadian corporate taxes. But, Burger King and your other brands are much larger, meaning more of total company revenues go towards the USA than Canada. And, because youâ€™re only somewhat owned by Canadian shareholders, the overwhelming majority of profits gets paid out to American investment firms and your Brazilian owned 3G capital. Basically Canadian money funds non-Canadian expansion while the profits are siphoned away from Canada.

So yes, youâ€™re Canadian operated, youâ€™d have to be to operate in Canada. But thatâ€™s true of McDonalds and any brand that has physical presence in Canada. Youâ€™re otherwise no more Canadian than them, or any other brand, besides your branding itself.

I recommend anyone reading this to, where possible, support actually Canadian owned brands, not Tim Hortons.

I do however wish I were wrong- so if thereâ€™s someone Iâ€™ve missed, please correct me.', 'You should be sued for false advertising. Tim Hortons is not and has not been a Canadian company for a long time', 'We are grateful for the incredible support of Tim Hortons in the Burlington community!']

title:
Special Olympics athlete Julia Romualdi tells Lainey about her involvement in Special Olympics as a figure skater, soccer player, as well as an Athlete Leader. Julia has introduced Special Olympics Unified Sports programs to high schools in her hometown of Timmins, Ontario to give more opportunities for participation and inclusion of students with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Tim Hortons is once again supporting that goal with the return of the Special Olympics Donut, available from January 31 to February 2. 100% of proceeds from sales of the donut will support community sport programs for more than 42,000 Special Olympics athletes across the country.

title:
Since 1975, @timscamps have helped to support over 325,000 youth aged 9 â€“ 16 from underserved communities unlock their potential. Each year, your generous donations from Camp Day, Holiday Smile Cookie and yearlong initiatives like Round Up on our mobile app or in-restaurant coin boxes, help raise funds to support and run all year-round programming for youth. Tims Camps are so much more than just a camp. They challenge young people. They help them see their best self. And they work with them as they carve a path towards the future they want.

For more information on @timscamps visit www.timscamps.com.

title:
Tims 60th anniversary CONTEST ğŸ‰ğŸ¥³ To celebrate 60, weâ€™re spotlighting stories about special moments or memories Canadians have shared with Tims. Share your Tims story for your chance to win tickets to The Last Timbit! Just drop a comment on this post, or post a pic in your feed with #TheLastTimbit. You could be one of the lucky 5 to win a trip for 2 to see our new musical at the Elgin Theatre in Toronto, Ontario, including round-trip economy airfare and a 2-night hotel stay.  
 
No purchase necessary. Contest runs April 25, 2024 at 12:00 a.m. ET to May 26, 2024 at 11:59 p.m. ET. Canada (excluding Quebec). Rules apply. See link in bio for full rules and regulations.
first_comments:
["I use to work on cruise ships. Every year when we would start our Alaska season we would port in vancouver twice per season because our embarkation was meant for Seattle but the crossing would end in vancouver. I would have 20 mins off the ship before I needed to go back to work and I would run off the ship, go across the street to the Tim's, meet my dad for a coffee for 10 mins, grab a 50 pack of tidbits and book it back to the ship. Technically I'm not really suppose to bring back on timbits but I would explain I'm Canadian and I need to share these with my team onboard. I was welcome back with open arms with these Canadian delicateces and was able to share them with my team from around the world. #TheLastTimbit", "First sips, fondest memories. My first taste of coffee was a sweet and creamy Timmies, back when I was just a kid. Then, life took me away from Canada for 20 long years. But guess what? That iconic Tim Hortons taste never left my heart (or my taste buds!). Now that I'm back in Canada, every day is a chance to relive that warm feeling with a cup of Timmies. #TheLastTimbit ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦", 'The title of this play is basically how my first experience with a birthday cake timbit went. Picture this, the summer they came out. Itâ€™s my birthday. My friends and I are road tripping to our camping spot and we stop in Bancroft ON for a break. There is one person in line ahead of us and theyâ€™ve finished placing their order. I eagerly squeal that itâ€™s all coming together, the last birthday cake timbit and itâ€™s my birthday? My friends are pumped for me. The gentleman ahead says â€œoh sorry can I order one more thing? The last birthday cake timbit.â€ We are now thinking heâ€™s the sweetest man in the world, he overheard us and was about to do the cutest pay it forward. He got the timbit, pulled it out of the bag, looked me in the eye and ate it. It was truly a rollercoaster of emotions.', 'I remember taking road trips with my family and being so excited to stop at tims for a tuscan chicken panini and a strawberry banana smoothie', "When I lived in Abu Dhabi, my friends and I loved hanging out at Tim Hortons. We'd sit there for hours, sipping coffee and dreaming about what it would be like to visit Canada, the home of Tim Hortons. We imagined snowy winters and cozy coffee shops filled with the smell of freshly brewed coffee.

Years later, I moved to Canada. The first thing I did was find a Tim Hortons. Walking in, I felt a rush of excitement. The first sip of coffee was even better than I had imagined. It was amazing.

My mom and I started going to Tim Hortons together all the time. We'd spend hours there, talking and enjoying our time together. Every visit felt special, full of laughter and love.

For me, Tim Hortons isn't just a coffee shop. It's a place where I make happy memories with my mom and remember my dreams coming trueâ¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ #TheLastTimbit", '#thelasttimbit I loved spending a road trip moving my daughter to her university a few provinces away and getting a 10 pack of timbits as a car snack most days of the trip.
